constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 147 (Tuesday, August 17, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. SEWELL:
H.R. 4.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
1) Section 5 of the Fourteenth Amendment to the United
States Constitution, granting Congress the authority to enact
appropriate laws to protect the civil rights of all
Americans;
2) Section 2 of the Fifteenth Amendment, granting Congress
the authority to protect against racial discrimination in
voting; and
3) Article I, Section 4, Clause 1 of the United States
Constitution, granting Congress the authority to make or
alter the regulations pertaining to Federal elections.
[Page H4338]
title: John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act of 2021
